skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Things in the Woods

skillTree.localised_description: Loyal, fierce, powerful and surprisingly fast – a War Bear is a symbol of Kislev itself.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Things in the Woods

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Drop these seeds into your garden and your harvest shall be bountiful indeed! But pick not the eye-laden stalk, not even once!"
Into the boughs and under the snow, where the witches dance and the new spring grows.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can pass through trees.

skillTree.localised_description: The natural state of the world is that of untouched wilderness, free from the meddling of all outsiders.

effects.description:
Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from Chaos attrition
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: From between the branches they came…

effects.description:
Charge Bonus: +16 for Things in the Woods, Incarnate Elemental of Beasts and Forest Animal units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Things in the Woods, Incarnate Elemental of Beasts and Forest Animal units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A root to bind arrows to the earth and a simple switch of wood from a young sprout to return their magics to the spring from which it came.
Of all the twisting of the Winds, curses come most naturally to the Hags.

effects.description: Effect duration: +50% for spells that debuff the enemy

skillTree.localised_description: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Awakening of the Wood"

skillTree.localised_description: Even the simplest of spells can bring forth the full bloom of renewal, reinvigorating and healing the broken and bleeding.
The Wizard draws wholesome energies from the soil, imbuing companions with the natural resilience of the earth.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Hit point replenishment cap not reached

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Earth Blood"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Earth Blood Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Earth Blood Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Prickly gorse bursts from the ground around the caster's allies, protecting them from attack like a spiky, living shield.

ui_effects.localised_text: Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker
Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker
Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: This spell temporarily transforms allies' mortal flesh into unbreakable rock, increasing tenfold their resistance to attack.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By speaking Druthandor's name the Wizard is able to heal allies' injuries much faster than by natural means.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Hit point replenishment cap not reached

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Regrowth Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: This spell causes gnarled, fibrous hands to emerge from beneath the ground, dragging the foe to a claustrophobic, suffocating end.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Dwellers Below"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Dwellers Below Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Dwellers Below Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Again, again, again! We'll practice this until your fingers bleed!"

skillTree.localised_description: "There's ice in the veins of the mighty Guards of Kislev, or so the rumour goes…"

skillTree.localised_description: The thunderous pounding of Kislevite hooves can be heard for leagues around, even muffled by the crunch of fresh snow.

Speed: +8% for Horse Archers, Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units

Missile strength: +8% for Horse Archers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The beasts that roam the forests of Kislev are somehow even more lethal than the land they inhabit.

Melee attack: +4 for War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear, Snow Leopard, Things in the Woods and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units

skillTree.localised_description: Kislevite craftsmen toil night and day, tinkering with contraptions to help repel the forces of Chaos.

skillTree.localised_description: The warriors of the north carry conflict in their blood, a legacy left by the Khan-Kings and Khan-Queens of old.

Melee attack: +5 for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Streltsi, Akshina Ambushers and Ice Guard units (Rank 7 and above)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Descended of the proud horse-warriors of the Gospodar, all Kislevites are born to the saddle like their ancestors before them.

Speed: +10% for Kossovite Dervishes, Horse Archers, Winged Lancers, and Gryphon Legion units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Ursun is with us, brothers! None can stand against the beasts of the Bear-God!"

skillTree.localised_description: The workshops of the north are always busy, their engineers working tirelessly in the pursuit of battle excellence.

Ammunition: +20% for War Sleds and Little Grom units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for War Sleds and Little Grom units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Things in the Woods

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although the eyes do not see, the other senses remain open.
Does a rage as hot as Khorne's burn within?
There are drunk Ogres more sure-footed than this one.
Deformed from birth or made so by the Ruinous Powers, yet there is honour within the prison of flesh.
"Look! Over there – a Snotling showing its arse!"
Honour is everything!
"This one is armless, sir."
"No, not drunk, just legless."
Such an ugly scar is always memorable.
Clearly a veteran of some heroic deed.
Shares the intellect of a River Troll.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
Some men are natural leaders, born to foster and marshal their tribes through devastating wars and the harshest of winters.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 when in own territory
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: For those used to life in the oblasts, keeping the elements out is only the beginning of the measures they must take to ensure the survival of their people.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 when in own territory
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This valorous warrior has been at the forefront of the struggle against Ruin before, and they certainly shall be again, steeled and girded by that dreadful experience.

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.
